content.question: Which of the following evidence does the author provide to support the claim that Luther’s theses were meant for a wider audience?

choices.label: Luther’s criticism of Johann Tetzel on theological grounds
Luther’s following of academic custom in publishing the theses in Latin
The translation of Luther’s theses and their rapid printing
The subtle nature of Luther’s criticism of a little-known figure such as Tetzel

content.answer: The translation of Luther’s theses and their rapid printing

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
